content:
That's a great idea! Having your mom make some traditional Indian sweets like gulab jamun and jalebi will definitely be a hit at your family dinner. They're classic Indian desserts that are loved by people of all ages, and they're sure to bring back fond memories for your family members.

And offering a variety of fruits like mangoes and bananas as a light and refreshing option is a great idea too. It's a wonderful way to provide a sweet treat that's also healthy and refreshing. You could also consider adding other fruits like oranges, grapes, or pineapple to the mix.

By offering a combination of traditional Indian sweets and fresh fruits, you'll have a dessert table that's sure to please everyone's sweet tooth. And, it's a great way to share your cultural heritage with your family and friends.

Remember to also consider any dietary restrictions or preferences when planning your dessert menu. You may want to have some sugar-free or gluten-free options available for guests who have specific dietary needs.

Overall, it sounds like you're planning a wonderful family dinner that's sure to be a hit with your loved ones. I hope everything goes smoothly and that you have a fantastic time celebrating with your family!
